column5: Hi everyone,  I've been a long time admirer of this community & I'd like to say a proper hello to all.  I fish all four seasons. All of my fish are catch & release. Most of my free time is searching for trout. I do alot of flyfishing/casting here in Ontario & in the Adirondacks......I'll start of with this little 9" brookie I caught this afternoon with a small sliver/yellow panther matrin with the two barbs sniped off & the remaining barb bent back, as are all of my lures & hooks. Just as Red Fisher would have wanted it.  Cheers to all.
welcome to the family enjoy this forum lots of nice folks with helpful information.  Never forget your camera

Welcome to the board kewl-blue.  Keep in mind when your planning on releasing fish, take care to not harm their slime coat. Putting them on the ground like that is terrible for it. The dry dirt or grass will absorb it all like a sponge. But at the end of the day, youre really doing the fish more of a favor releasing it than keeping it, so good for you.
Welcome aboard!  I love the colours on that speck.
Cool--I've caught a lot of fish on that exact same spinner out in the cricks  Bushart
Welcome to the community!  Beautiful fish there!
Your gonna love it here, welcome aboard
Welcome to the board! My favorite type of fish caught on my favorite type/colour of lure for them. Congrats and welcome again!
Welcome to OFC kewl-blue  I"m sure you'll enjoy this site... lots of information and great knowledgeable folks!!!  Leechman
